definition: to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
spouse/companion
surname Qiu

sentences.english: Sometimes siblings betray to each other in order to posse a piece of legacy.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，兄弟姐妹反目成仇，爲的是多的一份財產。

sentences.english: The two brothers have finally patched up their quarrel after years of bitter animosity.
sentences.chinese: 這對兄弟反目成仇了幾年後終於和好了。

sentences.english: Once we were close like brothers; now we have become enemies.
sentences.chinese: 曾經的親密兄弟，現在卻反目成仇。

sentences.english: I don't want to turn against you.
Thou canst not joke an enemy into a friend, but thou mayest a fiend into an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 開玩笑不可能化敵爲友，卻可能讓朋友反目成仇。

sentences.english: There are too many cases in which family members and friends quarrel with each other and become enemies, aren't there?
sentences.chinese: 親戚朋友之間因爲金錢而反目成仇的事兒還少嗎？

sentences.english: Friends are exposed as foes, heroes take on the taint of criminals, and no one can be trusted completely.
sentences.chinese: 朋友反目成仇，英雄墮落犯罪，無人可以完全信賴。

sentences.english: Sibling rivalry turned into betrayal between two brothers.

to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture

to have a falling out/to have a big argument
man and wife fall out (idiom, from Book of Changes); marital strife

to become enemies/to become hostile towards
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
wielding the halberd within the household (idiom); internecine strife
to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
